headline.seo: Avenue Road Opens Manhattan Showroom — Currents

docs.snippet: The Toronto-based furniture company has opened a 5,000-square-foot showroom in Manhattan designed to feel informal....

headline.print_headline: Eat Your Hake and Have It, Too
headline.seo: Eat Your Hake and Have It, Too
headline.main: Eat Your Hake and Have It, Too

docs.snippet: We can harvest a certain fraction of a fish population that has been overfished, if we allow for the natural processes of birth and growth to rebuild the stock....
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by authors Ray and Ulrike Hilborn argues that some popular boycotts of overfished species are unnecessary and ineffective; says attention should be directed at fisheries that consistently take more fish than can be naturally replaced; recommends specifically-targeted quota systems that create less harm for the fishing industry.

byline.original: By RAY HILBORN and ULRIKE HILBORN

docs.lead_paragraph: We can harvest a certain fraction of a fish population that has been overfished, if we allow for the natural processes of birth and growth to rebuild the stock.

headline.print_headline: Pull Up a Chair, Then Fix It
headline.seo: MakeShift Workshop to Rehabilitate Chair Castoffs at Partners & Spade
headline.main: Pull Up a Chair, Then Fix It

docs.snippet: Castoffs from the sidewalk and online are rescued, restored to life and then returned to the streets....

headline.print_headline: A Way Out of the Same-Sex Marriage Mess
headline.seo: A Way Out of the Same-Sex Marriage Mess
headline.main: A Way Out of the Same-Sex Marriage Mess

docs.snippet: The Supreme Court should hold that while states may refuse to authorize same-sex marriages, they may not void those marriages lawfully conducted in other states....

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Op-Ed column by Prof Mae Kuykendall suggests an ideal Supreme Court ruling would compel states that refuse to authorize same-sex marriages to recognize gay marriages lawfully conducted in other states; contends that such a ruling would bridge the gap between social progress, conservative interests and state sovereignty.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court should hold that while states may refuse to authorize same-sex marriages, they may not void those marriages lawfully conducted in other states.

headline.print_headline: Czechs Beat U.S. at Team World Cup

headline.main: Czechs Beat U.S. at Team World Cup

docs.snippet: The Czech Republic completed a 3-0 victory over the United States as Frantisek Cermak and Radek Stepanek defeated Andy Roddick and Ryan Harrison in the doubles at the Team World Cup....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Czech Republic completed a 3-0 victory over the United States as Frantisek Cermak and Radek Stepanek defeated Andy Roddick and Ryan Harrison in the doubles at the Team World Cup.

headline.print_headline: 30-Day Term Over Spying At Rutgers May Be Pared
headline.seo: Dharun Ravi’s Jail Term May Be Trimmed for Good Behavior
headline.main: Good Behavior May Reduce 30-Day Term in Rutgers Spying Case

docs.snippet: Dharun Ravi, whose sentence is being appealed by New Jersey prosecutors as too lenient, could earn credit for good behavior and for doing chores while in jail....

keywords.value: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Prosecutors are appealing the 30-day jail sentence imposed on Dharun Ravi as being too lenient; Ravi, who was convicted of spying on his Rutgers roommate Tyler Clementi's sexual encounter with another man, could serve just two-thirds of his sentence if he earns credit for good behavior in prison.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dharun Ravi, whose sentence is being appealed by New Jersey prosecutors as too lenient, could earn credit for good behavior and for doing chores while in jail.

headline.print_headline: Dam’s Flow Limit Loosened to Feed Grand Canyon
headline.seo: Dam Limits Loosened to Feed Grand Canyon
headline.main: Dam’s Flow Limit Loosened to Feed Grand Canyon

docs.snippet: The Interior Department will allow periodic flow increases at the Glen Canyon Dam to help the Colorado River replenish sediment in downstream ecosystems....
docs.abstract: Interior Department will allow periodic increases in the flow of Colorado River water through the Grand Canyon, alleviating the environmental disruption caused by the construction of the Glen Canyon Dam in Arizona in the 1960s.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Interior Department will allow periodic flow increases at the Glen Canyon Dam to help the Colorado River replenish sediment in downstream ecosystems.
